By studying and participating extensively in social activities on the campus. Adamu appeared to be biting more than he can chew. This means Adamu was

Choose from the options lettered A - E the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word

John is a very industrious man though people think he is____________
explanation:
The word "industrious" describes someone who is hardworking, diligent, and actively engaged in their work. The opposite of "industrious" would be someone who is lazy or not engaged in productive activities.
Option E, "idle," is the most nearly opposite in meaning to "industrious." "Idle" refers to being inactive, lazy, or not engaged in work or activities. Therefore, in the context of the sentence, "idle" is the most appropriate choice to convey the opposite meaning to "industrious."

Choose from the options lettered A - E the one that has a different stress pattern from the other four.


A. administration
B. participation
C. temperamental
D. consideration
E. civilization
explanation: Temperamental has a different stress pattern from the rest of the words. It is stressed on the third syllable, while the rest are stressed on the fourth syllable.

text:
Choose from the options lettered A to E, the one that has the same vowel sound as the one represented by the underlined letter(s).

Nose

Choose from the options lettered A-E the one that meet appropriately completes each sentence

Each of the authors received .................... royalties
explanation: The explanation lies in the principle of agreement between pronouns and their antecedents. In this case, "each" is a singular pronoun, and when referring to a singular antecedent, the corresponding possessive pronoun should also be singular. Therefore, the correct completion is "Each of the authors received his royalties," where "his" agrees in number with the singular antecedent "each."
